Turteltaub | birth_name = Harry Norman Turtledove | birth_date = | birth_place = Los Angeles, California, U.S. | death_date = | death_place = | alma_mater = California Institute of Technology (dropped out) University of California, Los Angeles | occupation = | genre = Science fiction, fantasy, alternate history, historical fiction, history | notableworks = | website = }} Harry Norman Turtledove (born June 14, 1949) is an American author. He is best known for his works about alternate history, historical fiction, fantasy, science fiction, and mystery fiction. His Worldwar series received a Sidewise Award for Alternate History Honorable Mention in 1996. In 1998, his novel How Few Remain won the Sidewise Award for Alternate History. He won his second Sidewise Award in 2003 for his novel Ruled Britannia. He won his third Sidewise Award for his short story "Zigeuner." ==References== Category:1949 births Category:Living people Category:American novelists Category:American historians Category:American essayists Category:Writers from Los Angeles
